meanings.definition: The practice of pretending to have knowledge or skills that one does not actually possess.
meanings.sent1: His charlatanism was exposed when he couldn't answer basic questions about the topic.
meanings.sent2: The community was wary of falling victim to charlatanism and sought out reputable experts instead.
meanings.sent3: The charlatanism of the self-proclaimed 'psychic' was revealed when he failed to predict the simplest outcomes.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his charlatanism like a glass pane, revealing the emptiness behind his claims.
meanings.sent5: The charlatanism of the salesman was as transparent as a ghost in broad daylight.

meanings.sent1: His flashy attire and smooth talk were clear signs of charlatanism to the discerning eye.
meanings.sent2: The audience was captivated by the charlatanism of the magician, unaware of the tricks up his sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The charlatanism of the street performer was entertaining until his act fell apart in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Her charm masked the charlatanism lurking beneath, deceiving those who were not vigilant.
meanings.sent5: The charlatanism of the con artist was like a dark shadow, looming over the unsuspecting victims.
